   11: %%

   13: %% distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
   14: %% WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.

   16: %% limitations under the License.
   17: %%
   18: %% %CopyrightEnd%
   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of traffic between seven Diameter nodes connected as follows.
   23: %%
   24: %%                                     --- SERVER1.REALM2
   25: %%                                   /
   26: %%                  ---- RELAY.REALM2 ---- SERVER2.REALM2
   27: %%                /        |
   28: %%   CLIENT.REALM1         |
   29: %%                \        |
   30: %%                  ---- RELAY.REALM3 ---- SERVER1.REALM3
   31: %%                                   \
   32: %%                                     --- SERVER2.REALM3
   33: %%
   34: 
   35: -module(diameter_relay_SUITE).
   36: 
   37: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   38: -export([run/0]).
   39: 
   40: %% common_test wrapping
   41: -export([
   42:          %% Framework functions
   43:          suite/0,
   44:          all/0,
   45:          init_per_suite/1,
   46:          end_per_suite/1,
   47:          init_per_testcase/2,
   48:          end_per_testcase/2,
   49:         
   50:          %% The test cases
   51:          parallel/1
   52:         ]).
   53: 
   54: %% diameter callbacks
   55: -export([pick_peer/4,
   56:          prepare_request/3,
   57:          prepare_retransmit/3,
   58:          handle_answer/4,
   59:          handle_request/3]).
   60: 
   61: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter_gen_base_rfc3588.hrl").
   63: 
   64: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   65: 
   66: 
   67: %% ===========================================================================
   68: 
   69: -define(ADDR, {127,0,0,1}).
   70: 
   71: -define(CLIENT,  "CLIENT.REALM1").
   72: -define(RELAY1,  "RELAY.REALM2").
   73: -define(SERVER1, "SERVER1.REALM2").
   74: -define(SERVER2, "SERVER2.REALM2").
   75: -define(RELAY2,  "RELAY.REALM3").
   76: -define(SERVER3, "SERVER1.REALM3").
   77: -define(SERVER4, "SERVER2.REALM3").
   78: 
   79: -define(SERVICES, [?CLIENT,
   80:                    ?RELAY1, ?RELAY2,
   81:                    ?SERVER1, ?SERVER2, ?SERVER3, ?SERVER4]).
   82: 
   83: -define(DICT_COMMON,  ?DIAMETER_DICT_COMMON).
   84: -define(DICT_RELAY,   ?DIAMETER_DICT_RELAY).
   85: 
   86: -define(APP_ALIAS, the_app).
   87: -define(APP_ID, ?DICT_COMMON:id()).
   88: 
   89: %% Config for diameter:start_service/2.
   90: -define(SERVICE(Host, Dict),
   91:         [{'Origin-Host', Host},
   92:          {'Origin-Realm', realm(Host)},
   93:          {'Host-IP-Address', [?ADDR]},
   94:          {'Vendor-Id', 12345},
   95:          {'Product-Name', "OTP/diameter"},
   96:          {'Acct-Application-Id', [Dict:id()]},
   97:          {application, [{alias, ?APP_ALIAS},
   98:                         {dictionary, Dict},
   99:                         {module, #diameter_callback{peer_up = false,
  100:                                                     peer_down = false,
  101:                                                     handle_error = false,
  102:                                                     default = ?MODULE}},
  103:                         {answer_errors, callback}]}]).
  104: 
  105: -define(SUCCESS, 2001).
  106: -define(LOOP_DETECTED, 3005).
  107: -define(UNABLE_TO_DELIVER, 3002).
  108: 
  109: -define(LOGOUT, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_TERMINATION-CAUSE_LOGOUT').
  110: -define(AUTHORIZE_ONLY, ?'DIAMETER_BASE_RE-AUTH-REQUEST-TYPE_AUTHORIZE_ONLY').
  111: 
  112: -define(RL(F),    ?RL(F, [])).
  113: -define(RL(F, A), ?LOG("DRELAYS", F, A)).
  114: 
  115: 
  116: %% ===========================================================================
  117: 
  118: suite() ->
  119:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
  120: 
  121: all() ->
  122:     [parallel].
  123: 
  124: 
  125: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  126:     ?RL("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  127:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  128:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
  129: 
  130: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  131:     ?RL("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  132:         "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
  133:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
  134: 
  135: 
  136: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
  137: init_per_testcase(parallel = Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> check factor", [Case]),
  139:     Key = dia_factor,
  140:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
  141:         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
  142:             ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
  143:                 [Case, Factor]),
  144:             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
  145:         _ ->
  146:             ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
  147:             Config
  148:     end;
  149: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  150:     ?RL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  151:     Config.
  152: 
  153: 
  154: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  155:     ?RL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  156:     Config.
  157: 
  158: 
  159: %% ===========================================================================
  160: 
  161: parallel(_Config) ->
  162:     ?RL("parallel -> entry"),
  163:     Res = run(),
  164:     ?RL("parallel -> done when"
  165:         "~n   Res: ~p", [Res]),
  166:     Res.
  167: 
  168: 
  169: %% ===========================================================================
  170: 
  171: %% run/0
  172: 
  173: run() ->
  174:     ok = diameter:start(),
  175:     try
  176:         ?RUN([{fun traffic/0, 20000}])
  177:     after
  178:         ok = diameter:stop()
  179:     end.
  180: 
  181: %% traffic/0
  182: 
  183: traffic() ->
  184:     ?RL("traffic -> start services"),
  185:     Servers = start_services(),
  186:     ?RL("traffic -> connect"),
  187:     Conns = connect(Servers),
  188:     ?RL("traffic -> send"),
  189:     [] = send(),
  190:     ?RL("traffic -> check counters"),
  191:     [] = counters(),
  192:     ?RL("traffic -> disconnect"),
  193:     [] = disconnect(Conns),
  194:     ?RL("traffic -> stop services"),
  195:     [] = stop_services(),
  196:     ?RL("traffic -> done"),
  197:     ok.
  198: 
  199: start_services() ->
  200:     [S1,S2,S3,S4] = [server(N, ?DICT_COMMON) || N <- [?SERVER1,
  201:                                                       ?SERVER2,
  202:                                                       ?SERVER3,
  203:                                                       ?SERVER4]],
  204:     [R1,R2] = [server(N, ?DICT_RELAY) || N <- [?RELAY1, ?RELAY2]],
  205: 
  206:     ok = diameter:start_service(?CLIENT, ?SERVICE(?CLIENT, ?DICT_COMMON)),
  207: 
  208:     [{?RELAY1, [S1,S2,R2]}, {?RELAY2, [S3,S4]}, {?CLIENT, [R1,R2]}].
  209: 
  210: connect(Servers) ->
  211:     lists:flatmap(fun({CN,Ss}) -> connect(CN, Ss) end, Servers).
  212: 
  213: disconnect(Conns) ->
  214:     [{T,C} || C <- Conns,
  215:               T <- [break(C)],
  216:               T /= ok].
  217: 
  218: stop_services() ->
  219:     [{H,T} || H <- ?SERVICES,
  220:               T <- [diameter:stop_service(H)],
  221:               T /= ok].
  222: 
  223: %% Traffic cases run when services are started and connections
  224: %% established.
  225: send() ->
  226:     ?RUN([[fun traffic/1, T] || T <- [send1,
  227:                                       send2,
  228:                                       send3,
  229:                                       send4,
  230:                                       send_loop,
  231:                                       send_timeout_1,
  232:                                       send_timeout_2,
  233:                                       info]]).
  234: 
  235: %% ----------------------------------------
  236: 
  237: break({{CN,CR},{SN,SR}}) ->
  238:     try
  239:         ?DISCONNECT(CN,CR,SN,SR)
  240:     after
  241:         diameter:remove_transport(SN, SR)
  242:     end.
  243: 
  244: server(Name, Dict) ->
  245:     ok = diameter:start_service(Name, ?SERVICE(Name, Dict)),
  246:     {Name, ?LISTEN(Name, tcp)}.
  247: 
  248: connect(Name, Refs) ->
  249:     [{{Name, ?CONNECT(Name, tcp, LRef)}, T} || {_, LRef} = T <- Refs].
  250: 
  251: %% ===========================================================================
  252: %% traffic testcases
  253: 
  254: %% Send an STR intended for a specific server and expect success.
  255: traffic(send1) ->
  256:     call(?SERVER1);
  257: traffic(send2) ->
  258:     call(?SERVER2);
  259: traffic(send3) ->
  260:     call(?SERVER3);
  261: traffic(send4) ->
  262:     call(?SERVER4);
  263: 
  264: %% Send an ASR that loops between the relays (RELAY1 -> RELAY2 ->
  265: %% RELAY1) and expect the loop to be detected.
  266: traffic(send_loop) ->
  267:     Req = ['ASR', {'Destination-Realm', realm(?SERVER1)},
  268:                   {'Destination-Host', ?SERVER1},
  269:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID}],
  270:     #'diameter_base_answer-message'{'Result-Code' = ?LOOP_DETECTED}
  271:         = call(Req, [{filter, realm}]);
  272: 
  273: %% Send a RAR that is incorrectly routed and then discarded and expect
  274: %% different results depending on whether or not we or the relay
  275: %% timeout first.
  276: traffic(send_timeout_1) ->
  277:     #'diameter_base_answer-message'{'Result-Code' = ?UNABLE_TO_DELIVER}
  278:         = traffic({timeout, 7000});
  279: traffic(send_timeout_2) ->
  280:     {error, timeout} = traffic({timeout, 3000});
  281: 
  282: traffic({timeout, Tmo}) ->
  283:     Req = ['RAR', {'Destination-Realm', realm(?SERVER1)},
  284:                   {'Destination-Host', ?SERVER1},
  285:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID},
  286:                   {'Re-Auth-Request-Type', ?AUTHORIZE_ONLY}],
  287:     call(Req, [{filter, realm}, {timeout, Tmo}]);
  288: 
  289: traffic(info) ->
  290:     %% Wait for RELAY1 to have answered all requests, so that the
  291:     %% suite doesn't end before all answers are sent and counted.
  292:     receive after 6000 -> ok end,
  293:     [] = ?INFO().
  294: 
  295: counters() ->
  296:     ?RUN([[fun counters/2, K, S]
  297:           || K <- [statistics, transport, connections],
  298:              S <- ?SERVICES]).
  299: 
  300: counters(Key, Svc) ->
  301:     counters(Key, Svc, [_|_] = diameter:service_info(Svc, Key)).
  302: 
  303: counters(statistics, Svc, Stats) ->
  304:     stats(Svc, lists:foldl(fun({K,N},D) -> orddict:update_counter(K, N, D) end,
  305:                            orddict:new(),
  306:                            lists:append([L || {P,L} <- Stats, is_pid(P)])));
  307: 
  308: counters(_, _, _) ->
  309:     todo.
  310: 
  311: stats(?CLIENT, L) ->
  312:     [{{{0,257,0},recv},2},   %% CEA
  313:      {{{0,257,1},send},2},   %% CER
  314:      {{{0,258,0},recv},1},   %% RAA (send_timeout_1)
  315:      {{{0,258,1},send},2},   %% RAR (send_timeout_[12])
  316:      {{{0,274,0},recv},1},   %% ASA (send_loop)
  317:      {{{0,274,1},send},1},   %% ASR (send_loop)
  318:      {{{0,275,0},recv},4},   %% STA (send[1-4])
  319:      {{{0,275,1},send},4},   %% STR (send[1-4])
  320:      {{{unknown,0},recv,discarded},1},  %% RAR (send_timeout_2)
  321:      {{{0,257,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% CEA
  322:      {{{0,258,0},recv,{'Result-Code',3002}},1},  %% RAA (send_timeout_1)
  323:      {{{0,274,0},recv,{'Result-Code',3005}},1},  %% ASA (send_loop)
  324:      {{{0,275,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},4}]  %% STA (send[1-4])
  325:         = L;
  326: 
  327: stats(S, L)
  328:   when S == ?SERVER1;
  329:        S == ?SERVER2;
  330:        S == ?SERVER3;
  331:        S == ?SERVER4 ->
  332:     [{{{0,257,0},send},1},   %% CEA
  333:      {{{0,257,1},recv},1},   %% CER
  334:      {{{0,275,0},send},1},   %% STA (send[1-4])
  335:      {{{0,275,1},recv},1},   %% STR (send[1-4])
  336:      {{{0,257,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},1},  %% CEA
  337:      {{{0,275,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},1}]  %% STA (send[1-4])
  338:         = L;
  339: 
  340: stats(?RELAY1, L) ->
  341:     [{{{relay,0},recv},3},   %% STA x 2 (send[12])
  342:                              %% ASA     (send_loop)
  343:      {{{relay,0},send},6},   %% STA x 2 (send[12])
  344:                              %% ASA x 2 (send_loop)
  345:                              %% RAA x 2 (send_timeout_[12])
  346:      {{{relay,1},recv},6},   %% STR x 2 (send[12])
  347:                              %% ASR x 2 (send_loop)
  348:                              %% RAR x 2 (send_timeout_[12])
  349:      {{{relay,1},send},5},   %% STR x 2 (send[12])
  350:                              %% ASR     (send_loop)
  351:                              %% RAR x 2 (send_timeout_[12])
  352:      {{{0,257,0},recv},3},   %% CEA
  353:      {{{0,257,0},send},1},   %%  "
  354:      {{{0,257,1},recv},1},   %% CER
  355:      {{{0,257,1},send},3},   %%  "
  356:      {{{relay,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  357:      {{{relay,0},recv,{'Result-Code',3005}},1},  %% ASA     (send_loop)
  358:      {{{relay,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  359:      {{{relay,0},send,{'Result-Code',3002}},2},  %% RAA     (send_timeout_[12])
  360:      {{{relay,0},send,{'Result-Code',3005}},2},  %% ASA     (send_loop)
  361:      {{{0,257,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},3},  %% CEA
  362:      {{{0,257,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},1}]  %%  "
  363:         = L;
  364: 
  365: stats(?RELAY2, L) ->
  366:     [{{{relay,0},recv},3},   %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  367:                              %% ASA     (send_loop)
  368:      {{{relay,0},send},3},   %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  369:                              %% ASA     (send_loop)
  370:      {{{relay,1},recv},5},   %% STR x 2 (send[34])
  371:                              %% RAR x 2 (send_timeout_[12])
  372:                              %% ASR     (send_loop)
  373:      {{{relay,1},send},3},   %% STR x 2 (send[34])
  374:                              %% ASR     (send_loop)
  375:      {{{0,257,0},recv},2},   %% CEA
  376:      {{{0,257,0},send},2},   %%  "
  377:      {{{0,257,1},recv},2},   %% CER
  378:      {{{0,257,1},send},2},   %%  "
  379:      {{{relay,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  380:      {{{relay,0},recv,{'Result-Code',3005}},1},  %% ASA     (send_loop)
  381:      {{{relay,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% STA x 2 (send[34])
  382:      {{{relay,0},send,{'Result-Code',3005}},1},  %% ASA     (send_loop)
  383:      {{{0,257,0},recv,{'Result-Code',2001}},2},  %% CEA
  384:      {{{0,257,0},send,{'Result-Code',2001}},2}]  %%  "
  385:         = L.
  386: 
  387: %% ===========================================================================
  388: 
  389: realm(Host) ->
  390:     tl(lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C /= $. end, Host)).
  391: 
  392: call(Server) ->
  393:     Realm = realm(Server),
  394:     %% Include some arbitrary AVPs to exercise encode/decode, that
  395:     %% are received back in the STA.
  396:     Avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 111,
  397:                           data = [#diameter_avp{code = 222,
  398:                                                 data = <<222:24>>},
  399:                                   #diameter_avp{code = 333,
  400:                                                 data = <<333:16>>}]},
  401:             #diameter_avp{code = 444,
  402:                           data = <<444:24>>},
  403:             #diameter_avp{code = 555,
  404:                           data = [#diameter_avp{code = 666,
  405:                                                 data = [#diameter_avp
  406:                                                         {code = 777,
  407:                                                          data = <<7>>}]},
  408:                                   #diameter_avp{code = 888,
  409:                                                 data = <<8>>},
  410:                                   #diameter_avp{code = 999,
  411:                                                 data = <<9>>}]}],
  412: 
  413:     Req = ['STR', {'Destination-Realm', Realm},
  414:                   {'Destination-Host', [Server]},
  415:                   {'Termination-Cause', ?LOGOUT},
  416:                   {'Auth-Application-Id', ?APP_ID},
  417:                   {'AVP', Avps}],
  418: 
  419:     #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  420:                        'Origin-Host' = Server,
  421:                        'Origin-Realm' = Realm,
  422:                        %% Unknown AVPs can't be decoded as Grouped since
  423:                        %% types aren't known.
  424:                        'AVP' = [#diameter_avp{code = 111},
  425:                                 #diameter_avp{code = 444},
  426:                                 #diameter_avp{code = 555}]}
  427:         = call(Req, [{filter, realm}]).
  428: 
  429: call(Req, Opts) ->
  430:     diameter:call(?CLIENT, ?APP_ALIAS, Req, Opts).
  431: 
  432: set([H|T], Vs) ->
  433:     [H | Vs ++ T].
  434: 
  435: %% ===========================================================================
  436: %% diameter callbacks
  437: 
  438: %% pick_peer/4
  439: 
  440: pick_peer([Peer | _], _, Svc, _State)
  441:   when Svc == ?RELAY1;
  442:        Svc == ?RELAY2;
  443:        Svc == ?CLIENT ->
  444:     {ok, Peer}.
  445: 
  446: %% prepare_request/3
  447: 
  448: prepare_request(Pkt, Svc, _Peer)
  449:   when Svc == ?RELAY1;
  450:        Svc == ?RELAY2 ->
  451:     {send, Pkt};
  452: 
  453: prepare_request(Pkt, ?CLIENT, {_Ref, Caps}) ->
  454:     {send, prepare(Pkt, Caps)}.
  455: 
  456: prepare(#diameter_packet{msg = Req}, Caps) ->
  457:     #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  458:                    origin_realm = {OR, _}}
  459:         = Caps,
  460:     set(Req, [{'Session-Id', diameter:session_id(OH)},
  461:               {'Origin-Host',  OH},
  462:               {'Origin-Realm', OR}]).
  463: 
  464: %% prepare_retransmit/3
  465: 
  466: prepare_retransmit(_Pkt, false, _Peer) ->
  467:     discard.
  468: 
  469: %% handle_answer/4
  470: 
  471: %% A relay must return Pkt.
  472: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, Svc, _Peer)
  473:   when Svc == ?RELAY1;
  474:        Svc == ?RELAY2 ->
  475:     Pkt;
  476: 
  477: handle_answer(Pkt, _Req, ?CLIENT, _Peer) ->
  478:     #diameter_packet{msg = Rec, errors = []} = Pkt,
  479:     Rec.
  480: 
  481: %% handle_request/3
  482: 
  483: handle_request(Pkt, OH, {_Ref, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH,_}} = Caps})
  484:   when OH /= ?CLIENT ->
  485:     request(Pkt, Caps).
  486: 
  487: %% RELAY1 answers ACR after it's timed out at the client.
  488: request(#diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{cmd_code = 271}},
  489:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {?RELAY1, _}}) ->
  490:     receive after 1000 -> {answer_message, 3004} end;  %% TOO_BUSY
  491: 
  492: %% RELAY1 routes any ASR or RAR to RELAY2.
  493: request(#diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{cmd_code = C}},
  494:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {?RELAY1, _}})
  495:   when C == 274;   %% ASR
  496:        C == 258 -> %% RAR
  497:     {relay, [{filter, {realm, realm(?RELAY2)}}]};
  498: 
  499: %% RELAY2 routes ASR back to RELAY1 to induce DIAMETER_LOOP_DETECTED.
  500: request(#diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{cmd_code = 274}},
  501:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {?RELAY2, _}}) ->
  502:     {relay, [{filter, {host, ?RELAY1}}]};
  503: 
  504: %% RELAY2 discards RAR to induce DIAMETER_UNABLE_TO_DELIVER.
  505: request(#diameter_packet{header = #diameter_header{cmd_code = 258}},
  506:         #diameter_caps{origin_host = {?RELAY2, _}}) ->
  507:     discard;
  508: 
  509: %% Other request to a relay: send on to one of the servers in the
  510: %% same realm.
  511: request(_Pkt, #diameter_caps{origin_host = {OH, _}})
  512:   when OH == ?RELAY1;
  513:        OH == ?RELAY2 ->
  514:     {relay, [{filter, {all, [host, realm]}}]};
  515: 
  516: %% Request received by a server: answer.
  517: request(#diameter_packet{msg = #diameter_base_STR{'Session-Id' = SId,
  518:                                                   'Origin-Host' = Host,
  519:                                                   'Origin-Realm' = Realm,
  520:                                                   'Route-Record' = Route,
  521:                                                   'AVP' = Avps}},
  522:         #diameter_caps{origin_host  = {OH, _},
  523:                        origin_realm = {OR, _}}) ->
  524: 
  525:     %% Payloads of unknown AVPs aren't decoded, so we don't know that
  526:     %% some types here are Grouped.
  527:     [#diameter_avp{code = 111, vendor_id = undefined},
  528:      #diameter_avp{code = 444, vendor_id = undefined, data = <<444:24>>},
  529:      #diameter_avp{code = 555, vendor_id = undefined}]
  530:         = Avps,
  531: 
  532:     %% The request should have the Origin-Host/Realm of the original
  533:     %% sender.
  534:     R = realm(?CLIENT),
  535:     {?CLIENT, R} = {Host, Realm},
  536:     %% A relay appends the identity of the peer that a request was
  537:     %% received from to the Route-Record avp.
  538:     [?CLIENT] = Route,
  539:     {reply, #diameter_base_STA{'Result-Code' = ?SUCCESS,
  540:                                'Session-Id' = SId,
  541:                                'Origin-Host' = OH,
  542:                                'Origin-Realm' = OR,
  543:                                'AVP' = Avps}}.
